text: Mt. Takao and the people of "So-to"
Yakuoin Temple on Mt. Takao and the silk industry in Hachioji...
The material for silk is made by insects called silkworms.
Therefore, silkworms were very important in the old days.
People then came to Yakuoin for silkworm charms.
During the Edo period, many people came to Hachioji-juku to get silkworm charms.
They were given out to many people who worked with silk,...
...and many people came to believe in the Yakuoin.
After that, people planted young trees at Yakuoin to thank the temple for the charms.
